title: Kind of a rant on people who say "muh follow your laner"
body:
Or people who do follow their laner because they have that mentality,but they're too late. I know I'm a silver player, but that doesn't make what I'm about to say invalid.

Ok anyway. Yes follow your laner, but if you're still in lane and your laner is already appeared at bot or top and you're still in lane. DON'T FOLLOW. instead take the tower or try. It's annoying for me to get 4 manned at bot or 3 manned at top and mid is just sitting there last hitting minions. Don't last hit minions and slow push. HARD PUSH THAT SHIT. 

Ok I'm ready for the down-vote squad.

Edit: Fixing a few mistakes in my post for more {{summoner:13}} .

I'm formerly the 69th best Viktor in NA. I was in but lost my Diamond promos filled with D5s and D4s three times this season, and eventually quit playing because I hate this season. I probably could have continued climbing if I gave a fuck, but since I do not, I have since decayed to Platinum V. 

So speaking as a higher elo player?

**Don't** follow your fucking laner. 

If you don't have vision of their jungler and/or the enemy laner can solo kill you, all you are doing by following them is putting yourself at risk. If the enemy is roaming and they know what they're doing, you'll be missing minions and allowing your turret to take damage, too.

That's not to say that you can't follow your laner or shouldn't ever do so, but it is heavily dependent upon the match up, what else is happening on the map, and so on and so forth. Most of the time, your best play is going to be to shove a wave, recall to buy items and gain tempo/lane control, pressure their turret, farm the jungle, get vision, or roam to the other side of the map.

If you're Katarina against a Lux and the Lux goes missing you can probably follow her. She's an easy solo kill. But if Katarina roams and you're Lux? You're asking to feed the enemy assassin by blindly following them into the fog of war. Think about it, even if you do follow them and manage to turn a fight in another lane, the reason that happened is because the enemy overstayed and/or was too far out. You're expecting them to make that mistake. If they back off once they notice you are following your laner, you gain nothing, but the enemy team gains tempo.

Ideally, your allies back off and play safe when they notice your laner has roamed. This wastes your laner's time on a pointless roam, meanwhile, you gain some CS, vision, wave control, etc.

If your team won't play safe and dies to every roam it isn't your fault, it's theirs, and you shouldn't try and fix their mistakes. You're more than likely to get yourself killed trying to help them if they are that incompetent.

It all boils down to _do something. _

Either follow your laner for a countergank or shove your lane to turret. Stop sitting in the middle of your lane twiddling your thumbs.

Yesterday i had a 0/1/0 yasuo in a 30 min game all he was doing was farm mid. Didn't even take the mid tower LMAO. When we asked why he was basically afking all he said was ".!.". If you do not follow ur laner 2-3 times but u apply pressure it's ok but if u just care for kda and farm you're not okay.

Honestly the follow your laner meme reminds me of season 2 where people raged if you didn't target the adc. As the adc. The sole purpose of adc's back then was to chew through the front line, and if the enemy adc positioned well walking up to target them just resulted in you dying. Very very game, teamcomp and teamfight dependent on whether it was the right choice. Same here. It's a whine brought on by people who grasp a certain amount of flawed info on how to play the game.

Before you do any of the above, make sure you PING, don't just pushing without pinging your laners (It happens too much, even in plat)

As a {{champion:163}} player, I shove and roam the other side, of course.

I'd say it depends on the match up.

Maybe don't follow the level 6 {{champion:238}} if you're playing {{champion:45}}. Just spam ping that Zed is coming, maybe type in chat, but there are some matchups where following your laner is almost never the proper choice.

Like almost any mage against {{champion:91}} early game.

Obviously still push, but for a few champs, following isn't the best option. Especially against assassins.

News flash, if a slow ass no mobility champ tries to follow a Zed or LeBlanc (who usually has kills from teammates) they will instantly die. People don't seem to get that.

It depends on the champion you are playing and who you are playing against. If I am lux and my enemy is Zed I am not going to follow Zed, but I will warn my bot lane. 

If I am Ekko and I am versing Zed I might follow him pending on a things, but these are things you should consider every time.
1. will I have any significant impact going to bot lane (am I behind, is my lane behind, is my bot lane ahead, can my bot lane hold a siege under their tower)
2. Is bot under tower or attacking the enemy tower, can they be safe while I push mid lane, is our jungle around bot lane to help or around mid to push down mid tower with me?
3. Do we have good vision of the quickest path to assist bot lane if yes take that lane, and if we do not have good vision what is the safest way (aka don't want to be caught by the enemy mid laner and jungler) and if I take the safest way will I reach bot lane in time to assist?
mages should be cautious following assassins, like lol.  If your lux, and not following zed, that's not the worst, just tell your team. Zed could be in river bush ready to pounce on you.

Gotta agree I play immobile mages like malz, veigar, ect. I keep an eye on my laner best I can and ping missing but ain't no way in hell will I follow them into the darker parts of the map unless I'm stupidly fed.
